column1: # Stage 3 / Steady-State Conductivity Data Extracted from Flash Sintering Papers
# This data captures conductivity DURING flash (Stage III) - not just at onset
# 1. Raj 2012 (Joule Heating) - 8YSZ steady-state under current control
# 3. Gaur & Sglavo 2014 (MnCo2O4) - Specimen temperatures during flash
# 8YSZ - Raj 2012 (Joule Heating) Table 1 - Dense sample under current control
# These are EXACT measurements during Stage III steady-state

column1: # TiO2 - Jha & Raj 2014 Table I - Post-flash steady state under current control
# E_stage3 is the measured field AFTER switching to current control
# GDC (Gd-doped CeO2) - Mishra et al. 2021 (J Am Ceram Soc) - Processing map for GDC

column14: Isothermal flash - T_s from BBR/pyrometer - σ from J/E

column1: # MnCo2O4 - Gaur & Sglavo 2014 Table 1 - Direct pyrometer specimen temperature
# Conductivity calculated from steady-state I-V curves (Fig 6b) ~27.5 S/cm at 1000C
# Ea from Arrhenius fit of conductivity data (Fig 5): ~0.33 eV (small polaron hopping)
# J values given in A/mm2 = 1000 mA/mm2

column14: Table 1 - pyrometer T - σ from Fig 6b extrapolated
Table 1 - pyrometer T - σ from Fig 6b

column1: # 3YSZ - Francis & Raj 2013 (Isothermal) Table I - Steady state under current control
# W - Bamidele et al. 2024 - Current rate flash sintering
# Sintering at ~1000C regardless of current rate
# Ni - Bamidele et al. 2024 - Current rate flash sintering
# TCP (β-Tricalcium Phosphate) - Frasnelli & Sglavo 2018 (J Eur Ceram Soc)
# Resistivity parameters: ρ₀ = 0.0013 Ωm → σ₀ = 769 S/m
# Ea = 82 kJ/mol = 0.85 eV from Arrhenius fit
# T_specimen estimated from BBR model at Stage III: ~1500-1700K
# σ calculated from σ = σ₀ exp(-Ea/kT) at T_specimen

column14: Estimated from Arrhenius params - σ₀=769 S/m
Estimated from Arrhenius params - σ₀=769 S/m
Estimated from Arrhenius params - σ₀=769 S/m

column1: # CCTO (CaCu3Ti4O12) - Jesus et al. 2016 (J Alloys Compd)
# Ea = 1.0-1.3 eV from grain-boundary limited conduction (use 1.15 eV avg)
# σ estimated from J/E_onset (lower bound since E drops in Stage III)
# Note: Different mechanism (IBLC) - use with caution
